de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.uomm

Class SmoothMotion

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.mobisim.core.ExtensionModule
      • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.mobisim.mobilitymodels.Movement
        • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.uomm.UserOrientedMovement
          • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.uomm.SmoothMotion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NotificationListener, XMLStreamable

    public class SmoothMotion
extends UserOrientedMovement
    This class implements Smooth Motion Movement Behavior. The implementation is based on C. Bettstetter, "Smooth is Better than Sharp: A Random Mobility Model for Simulation of Wireless Networks", Proceedings of the 4th ACM International Workshop on Modeling, Analysis, and Simulation of Wireless and Mobile Systems (MSWiM'01), Rome, Italy, July 2001.

    Author:
    Illya Stepanov

      Minimal acceleration (in meters/ms^2)
      protected Vector3D movement
      Current movement vector
      protected long nextSpeedChangeTime
      Time when the next speed changing occurs (in steps)

      Preferred speeds, key - Float(speed), value - Float(p)
      protected int stay
      Current stay duration at destination (ms)
      protected boolean stayRandom
      Flag to indicate that a random stay duration must be chosen at the beginning of the simulation
      protected float targetSpeed
      Target speed (in meters/ms)
      protected Trip trip
      Current trip

      • act

        public int act()
        Executes the extension.

        The method is called on every simulation timestep.
        Specified by:
        act in class ExtensionModule
        Returns:
        0 - the module should be executed on next timesteps, -1 - the module should not be executed on further timesteps and should be removed from the extensions' list
